affiliation.ce:source-text: Steven Rosefielde is Professor of Economics at the University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill and a member of the Russian Academy of Natural Sciences
Jonathan Leightner teaches at Augusta University in the United States and Chulalongkorn University in Thailand
Jonathan Leightner teaches at Augusta University in the United States and Chulalongkorn University in Thailand

head.citation-title: China's market communism: Challenges, dilemmas, solutions
head.abstracts: © 2018 Steven Rosefielde and Jonathan Leightner.China’s Market Communism guides readers step by step up the ladder of China’s reforms and transformational possibilities to a full understanding of Beijing’s communist and post-communist options by investigating the lessons that Xi can learn from Mao, Adam Smith and inclusive economic theory. The book sharply distinguishes what can be immediately accomplished from the road that must be traversed to better futures.

source.sourcetitle-abbrev: China's Market Communism: Challenges, Dilemmas, Solutions
source.sourcetitle: China's Market Communism: Challenges, Dilemmas, Solutions

affiliation.affilname: The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

coredata.dc:description: China’s Market Communism guides readers step by step up the ladder of China’s reforms and transformational possibilities to a full understanding of Beijing’s communist and post-communist options by investigating the lessons that Xi can learn from Mao, Adam Smith and inclusive economic theory. The book sharply distinguishes what can be immediately accomplished from the road that must be traversed to better futures.
coredata.prism:publicationName: China's Market Communism: Challenges, Dilemmas, Solutions
coredata.dc:title: China's market communism: Challenges, dilemmas, solutions
